comments:
CDT 2.0.0.200405290301
On RedHat Linux EL3

During a debug session, I open the Registers view
and it is empty.
I see a bunch of error messages on the Debugger Console:
Target request failed: No symbol "eax" (etc.) in current context
The content of the Registers view is driven by the selection in the Debug view. 
The registers are displayed only if a stack frame is selected. Make sure that 
you have a stack frame selected in the Debug view.
The error messages in the debug console reflect are not bugs, they just reflect 
the internal communication with gdb.
Hmmm... thanks Mikhail.

Okay, on Suse LES 9 beta 4, I see the registers view as you describe.
I wasn't seeing *anything* before on RedHat, and will try to reproduce.
In the meantime,

EXPECTED #1: If I have the wrong thing selected when the Registers View
is visible, the Registers should not be blank but should say something
like "Select a stack frame at a breakpoint to view registers"

EXPECTED #2: Don't clog up the Error Log with all these exceptions:

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.cdt.debug.core 4 5010 Jun 02, 2004 09:47:19.941
!MESSAGE Target request failed: No symbol "fs" in current context.

>EXPECTED #1: If I have the wrong thing selected when the Registers View
>is visible, the Registers should not be blank but should say something
>like "Select a stack frame at a breakpoint to view registers"

The whole Eclipse debug framework is driven by the item selected in the Debug 
view. The registers' value make sense only in the context of a stack frame. 
That's the basics that should be described in the documentation. And the 
Variables view does exactly the same.

>EXPECTED #2: Don't clog up the Error Log with all these exceptions:
Agreed.

I have been able to reproduce this and I will submit the fix soon.
I am not sure that it's the same problem, but if I open the Registers view when 
the session is running, each register has the "<not responding>" label.
The fix for this has been submitted.

>EXPECTED #2: Don't clog up the Error Log with all these exceptions:
Done.
Thanks Mikhail.

I was unable to reproduce the original symptom on RedHat.

Verified on 2.0.0.200406030301
- No <not responding> for local host
- No error messages in log file

*** Bug 66579 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
